revised_title: Growth Patterns and Mathematical Analysis of Discoid and Turbinated Shells
tldr: The author examines the growth patterns of discoid and turbinated shells, using mathematical analysis to understand the ratios and coefficients that determine their shapes. The study focuses on the measurements of univalve shells and the relationships between the elongation of the radius vector, the linear expansion of the generating figure, and the translation or slipping of the spiral on the central axis. The findings reveal five possible combinations of these factors, leading to different shell forms.
